intro: Kyrstenia pazcuarensis, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, adapting to the harsh mountain climate. Kyrstenia pazcuarensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
